meanings.definition: A punch delivered from below with an upward motion.
meanings.sent1: He landed a powerful uppercut on his opponent's chin.
meanings.sent2: The boxer's signature move was the devastating uppercut.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to perform an uppercut on the punching bag, but ended up hitting his own nose.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a verbal uppercut, leaving him speechless.
meanings.sent5: The uppercut in the movie was so realistic, it made the audience flinch.

meanings.sent1: She uppercut her opponent with precision during the boxing match.
meanings.sent2: The boxer decided to uppercut his way to victory.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to uppercut the dough to make it rise faster, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to uppercut through her defenses, revealing her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's movements were so fluid, it looked like she could uppercut the air itself.
